article_title: Serious ACA wrinkle jeopardizes help for chronic patients
article_text:
Federal guidance issued by the US Centers for Medicare and Medicaid is allowing health insurers to reject patients who receive premium assistance from nonprofit charities

North Carolina is one of 38 states with health plans now denying coverage

Premium assistance programs serve as lifelines to many patients, particularly those with debilitating and expensive medical conditions, and must be protected

article_metadata.news-keywords: ACA, affordable, care, act, health, insurance, nonprofit, assistance, program, payment, charity, nc, north carolina, medicaid, medicare, hemophilia, cowell
article_metadata.description: Despite a significant uptick in the number of insured North Carolinians as a result of the Affordable Care Act, federal guidance might have inadvertently created a new “pre-existing condition” that is jeopardizing this coverage for many of our state’s most vulnerable patients.
